00044 #define ELEM(a, b, c)           ( (a)==(b) || (a)==(c) )
00045 #define ELEM3(a, b, c, d)       ( ELEM(a, b, c) || (a)==(d) )
00046 #define ELEM4(a, b, c, d, e)    ( ELEM(a, b, c) || ELEM(a, d, e) )
00047 #define ELEM5(a, b, c, d, e, f) ( ELEM(a, b, c) || ELEM3(a, d, e, f) )
00048 #define ELEM6(a, b, c, d, e, f, g)      ( ELEM(a, b, c) || ELEM4(a, d, e, f, g) )
00049 #define ELEM7(a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h)   ( ELEM3(a, b, c, d) || ELEM4(a, e, f, g, h) )
00050 #define ELEM8(a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i)        ( ELEM4(a, b, c, d, e) || ELEM4(a, f, g, h, i) )
00051 #define ELEM9(a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, j)        ( ELEM4(a, b, c, d, e) || ELEM5(a, f, g, h, i, j) )
00052 #define ELEM10(a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, j, k)        ( ELEM4(a, b, c, d, e) || ELEM6(a, f, g, h, i, j, k) )
00053 #define ELEM11(a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, j, k, l)        ( ELEM4(a, b, c, d, e) || ELEM7(a, f, g, h, i, j, k, l) )
00054 
00055 /* shift around elements */
00056 #define SHIFT3(type, a, b, c)  {                                              \
00057         type tmp;                                                             \
00058         tmp = a;                                                              \
00059         a = c;                                                                \
00060         c = b;                                                                \
00061         b = tmp;                                                              \
00062     } (void)0
00063 #define SHIFT4(type, a, b, c, d)  {                                           \
00064         type tmp;                                                             \
00065         tmp = a;                                                              \
00066         a = d;                                                                \
00067         d = c;                                                                \
00068         c = b;                                                                \
00069         b = tmp;                                                              \
00070     } (void)0

00072 /* min/max */
00073 #define MIN2(x,y)               ( (x)<(y) ? (x) : (y) )
00074 #define MIN3(x,y,z)             MIN2( MIN2((x),(y)) , (z) )
00075 #define MIN4(x,y,z,a)           MIN2( MIN2((x),(y)) , MIN2((z),(a)) )
00076 
00077 #define MAX2(x,y)               ( (x)>(y) ? (x) : (y) )
00078 #define MAX3(x,y,z)             MAX2( MAX2((x),(y)) , (z) )
00079 #define MAX4(x,y,z,a)           MAX2( MAX2((x),(y)) , MAX2((z),(a)) )

00081 #define INIT_MINMAX(min, max) {                                               \
00082         (min)[0]= (min)[1]= (min)[2]= 1.0e30f;                                \
00083         (max)[0]= (max)[1]= (max)[2]= -1.0e30f;                               \
00084     }
00085 #define INIT_MINMAX2(min, max) {                                              \
00086         (min)[0]= (min)[1]= 1.0e30f;                                          \
00087         (max)[0]= (max)[1]= -1.0e30f;                                         \
00088     } (void)0
00089 #define DO_MIN(vec, min) {                                                    \
00090         if( (min)[0]>(vec)[0] ) (min)[0]= (vec)[0];                           \
00091         if( (min)[1]>(vec)[1] ) (min)[1]= (vec)[1];                           \
00092         if( (min)[2]>(vec)[2] ) (min)[2]= (vec)[2];                           \
00093     } (void)0
00094 #define DO_MAX(vec, max) {                                                    \
00095         if( (max)[0]<(vec)[0] ) (max)[0]= (vec)[0];                           \
00096         if( (max)[1]<(vec)[1] ) (max)[1]= (vec)[1];                           \
00097         if( (max)[2]<(vec)[2] ) (max)[2]= (vec)[2];                           \
00098     } (void)0
00099 #define DO_MINMAX(vec, min, max) {                                            \
00100         if( (min)[0]>(vec)[0] ) (min)[0]= (vec)[0];                           \
00101         if( (min)[1]>(vec)[1] ) (min)[1]= (vec)[1];                           \
00102         if( (min)[2]>(vec)[2] ) (min)[2]= (vec)[2];                           \
00103         if( (max)[0]<(vec)[0] ) (max)[0]= (vec)[0];                           \
00104         if( (max)[1]<(vec)[1] ) (max)[1]= (vec)[1];                           \
00105         if( (max)[2]<(vec)[2] ) (max)[2]= (vec)[2];                           \
00106     } (void)0
00107 #define DO_MINMAX2(vec, min, max) {                                           \
00108         if( (min)[0]>(vec)[0] ) (min)[0]= (vec)[0];                           \
00109         if( (min)[1]>(vec)[1] ) (min)[1]= (vec)[1];                           \
00110         if( (max)[0]<(vec)[0] ) (max)[0]= (vec)[0];                           \
00111         if( (max)[1]<(vec)[1] ) (max)[1]= (vec)[1];                           \
00112     } (void)0

00117 #  define SWAP(type, a, b)       { type sw_ap; sw_ap=(a); (a)=(b); (b)=sw_ap; }

00120 #define ABS(a)          ( (a)<0 ? (-(a)) : (a) )

00122 #define FTOCHAR(val) ((val)<=0.0f)? 0 : (((val)>(1.0f-0.5f/255.0f))? 255 : (char)((255.0f*(val))+0.5f))
00123 #define FTOUSHORT(val) ((val >= 1.0f-0.5f/65535)? 65535: (val <= 0.0f)? 0: (unsigned short)(val*65535.0f + 0.5f))
00124 #define USHORTTOUCHAR(val) ((unsigned char)(((val) >= 65535-128)? 255: ((val)+128)>>8))
00125 #define F3TOCHAR3(v2, v1) {                                                   \
00126         (v1)[0]= FTOCHAR((v2[0]));                                            \
00127         (v1)[1]= FTOCHAR((v2[1]));                                            \
00128         (v1)[2]= FTOCHAR((v2[2]));                                            \
00129     } (void)0
00130 #define F3TOCHAR4(v2, v1) {                                                   \
00131         (v1)[0]= FTOCHAR((v2[0]));                                            \
00132         (v1)[1]= FTOCHAR((v2[1]));                                            \
00133         (v1)[2]= FTOCHAR((v2[2]));                                            \
00134         (v1)[3]= 255;                                                         \
00135     } (void)0
00136 #define F4TOCHAR4(v2, v1) {                                                   \
00137         (v1)[0]= FTOCHAR((v2[0]));                                            \
00138         (v1)[1]= FTOCHAR((v2[1]));                                            \
00139         (v1)[2]= FTOCHAR((v2[2]));                                            \
00140         (v1)[3]= FTOCHAR((v2[3]));                                            \
00141     } (void)0
00142 #define VECCOPY(v1, v2) {                                                     \
00143         *(v1)=   *(v2);                                                       \
00144         *(v1+1)= *(v2+1);                                                     \
00145         *(v1+2)= *(v2+2);                                                     \
00146     } (void)0
00147 #define VECCOPY2D(v1, v2) {                                                   \
00148         *(v1)=   *(v2);                                                       \
00149         *(v1+1)= *(v2+1);                                                     \
00150     } (void)0
00151 #define VECADD(v1,v2,v3) {                                                    \
00152         *(v1)=   *(v2)   + *(v3);                                             \
00153         *(v1+1)= *(v2+1) + *(v3+1);                                           \
00154         *(v1+2)= *(v2+2) + *(v3+2);                                           \
00155     } (void)0
00156 #define VECSUB(v1,v2,v3) {                                                    \
00157         *(v1)=   *(v2)   - *(v3);                                             \
00158         *(v1+1)= *(v2+1) - *(v3+1);                                           \
00159         *(v1+2)= *(v2+2) - *(v3+2);                                           \
00160     } (void)0
00161 #define VECSUB2D(v1,v2,v3)     {                                              \
00162         *(v1)=   *(v2)   - *(v3);                                             \
00163         *(v1+1)= *(v2+1) - *(v3+1);                                           \
00164     } (void)0
00165 #define VECADDFAC(v1,v2,v3,fac) {                                             \
00166         *(v1)=   *(v2)   + *(v3)*(fac);                                       \
00167         *(v1+1)= *(v2+1) + *(v3+1)*(fac);                                     \
00168         *(v1+2)= *(v2+2) + *(v3+2)*(fac);                                     \
00169     } (void)0
00170 #define VECSUBFAC(v1,v2,v3,fac) {                                             \
00171         *(v1)=   *(v2)   - *(v3)*(fac);                                       \
00172         *(v1+1)= *(v2+1) - *(v3+1)*(fac);                                     \
00173         *(v1+2)= *(v2+2) - *(v3+2)*(fac);                                     \
00174     } (void)0

00176 #define INPR(v1, v2) ( (v1)[0]*(v2)[0] + (v1)[1]*(v2)[1] + (v1)[2]*(v2)[2] )

00178 /* some misc stuff.... */
00179 #define CLAMP(a, b, c)      if((a)<(b)) (a)=(b); else if((a)>(c)) (a)=(c)
00180 #define CLAMPIS(a, b, c) ((a)<(b) ? (b) : (a)>(c) ? (c) : (a))
00181 #define CLAMPTEST(a, b, c)                                                    \
00182     if ((b) < (c)) {                                                          \
00183         CLAMP(a, b, c);                                                       \
00184     }                                                                         \
00185     else {                                                                    \
00186         CLAMP(a, c, b);                                                       \
00187     } (void)
00188 
00189 #define IS_EQ(a,b) ((fabs((double)(a)-(b)) >= (double) FLT_EPSILON) ? 0 : 1)
00190 #define IS_EQF(a,b) ((fabsf((float)(a)-(b)) >= (float) FLT_EPSILON) ? 0 : 1)
00191 
00192 #define IS_EQT(a, b, c) ((a > b)? (((a-b) <= c)? 1:0) : ((((b-a) <= c)? 1:0)))
00193 #define IN_RANGE(a, b, c) ((b < c)? ((b<a && a<c)? 1:0) : ((c<a && a<b)? 1:0))
00194 #define IN_RANGE_INCL(a, b, c) ((b < c)? ((b<=a && a<=c)? 1:0) : ((c<=a && a<=b)? 1:0))

00196 /* array helpers */
00197 #define ARRAY_LAST_ITEM(arr_start, arr_dtype, elem_size, tot)                 \
00198         (arr_dtype *)((char*)arr_start + (elem_size*(tot - 1)))
00199 
00200 #define ARRAY_HAS_ITEM(item, arr_start, arr_dtype, elem_size, tot) (          \
00201         (item >= arr_start) &&                                                \
00202         (item <= ARRAY_LAST_ITEM(arr_start, arr_dtype, elem_size, tot))       \
00203     )

00205 /* This one rotates the bytes in an int64, int (32) and short (16) */
00206 #define SWITCH_INT64(a) {                                                     \
00207         char s_i, *p_i;                                                       \
00208         p_i= (char *)&(a);                                                    \
00209         s_i= p_i[0]; p_i[0]= p_i[7]; p_i[7]= s_i;                             \
00210         s_i= p_i[1]; p_i[1]= p_i[6]; p_i[6]= s_i;                             \
00211         s_i= p_i[2]; p_i[2]= p_i[5]; p_i[5]= s_i;                             \
00212         s_i= p_i[3]; p_i[3]= p_i[4]; p_i[4]= s_i;                             \
00213     } (void)0
00214 
00215 #define SWITCH_INT(a) {                                                       \
00216         char s_i, *p_i;                                                       \
00217         p_i= (char *)&(a);                                                    \
00218         s_i= p_i[0]; p_i[0]= p_i[3]; p_i[3]= s_i;                             \
00219         s_i= p_i[1]; p_i[1]= p_i[2]; p_i[2]= s_i;                             \
00220     } (void)0
00221 
00222 #define SWITCH_SHORT(a) {                                                     \
00223         char s_i, *p_i;                                                       \
00224         p_i= (char *)&(a);                                                    \
00225         s_i=p_i[0]; p_i[0]=p_i[1]; p_i[1]=s_i;                                \
00226     } (void)0

00229 /* Warning-free macros for storing ints in pointers. Use these _only_
00230  * for storing an int in a pointer, not a pointer in an int (64bit)! */
00231 #define SET_INT_IN_POINTER(i)    ((void *)(intptr_t)(i))
00232 #define GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(i)  ((int)(intptr_t)(i))
00233 
00234 /* Macro to convert a value to string in the preprocessor
00235  * STRINGIFY_ARG: gives the argument as a string
00236  * STRINGIFY_APPEND: appends any argument 'b' onto the string argument 'a',
00237  *   used by STRINGIFY because some preprocessors warn about zero arguments
00238  * STRINGIFY: gives the argument's value as a string */
00239 #define STRINGIFY_ARG(x) "" #x
00240 #define STRINGIFY_APPEND(a, b) "" a #b
00241 #define STRINGIFY(x) STRINGIFY_APPEND("", x)
00242 
00243 /* useful for debugging */
00244 #define AT __FILE__ ":" STRINGIFY(__LINE__)
00245 
00246 /* so we can use __func__ everywhere */
00247 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00248 #  define __func__ __FUNCTION__
00249 #endif

00252 /* UNUSED macro, for function argument */
00253 #ifdef __GNUC__
00254 #  define UNUSED(x) UNUSED_ ## x __attribute__((__unused__))
00255 #else
00256 #  define UNUSED(x) UNUSED_ ## x
00257 #endif
00258 
00259 #ifdef __GNUC__
00260 #  define UNUSED_FUNCTION(x) __attribute__((__unused__)) UNUSED_ ## x
00261 #else
00262 #  define UNUSED_FUNCTION(x) UNUSED_ ## x
00263 #endif
00264 
00265 #ifdef __GNUC__
00266 #  define WARN_UNUSED  __attribute__((warn_unused_result))
00267 #else
00268 #  define WARN_UNUSED
00269 #endif

00271 /*little macro so inline keyword works*/
00272 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00273 #  define BLI_INLINE static __forceinline
00274 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
00275 #  define BLI_INLINE static inline __attribute((always_inline))
00276 #else
00277 /* #warning "MSC/GNUC defines not found, inline non-functional" */
00278 #  define BLI_INLINE static
00279 #endif

00281 
00282 /* BLI_assert(), default only to print
00283  * for aborting need to define WITH_ASSERT_ABORT
00284  */
00285 #ifndef NDEBUG
00286 #  ifdef WITH_ASSERT_ABORT
00287 #    define _BLI_DUMMY_ABORT abort
00288 #  else
00289 #    define _BLI_DUMMY_ABORT() (void)0
00290 #  endif
00291 #  if defined(__GNUC__) || defined(_MSC_VER) /* check __func__ is available */
00292 #    define BLI_assert(a)                                                     \
00293     (void)((!(a)) ?  (                                                        \
00294         (                                                                     \
00295         fprintf(stderr,                                                       \
00296             "BLI_assert failed: %s:%d, %s(), at \'%s\'\n",                    \
00297             __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, STRINGIFY(a)),                      \
00298         _BLI_DUMMY_ABORT(),                                                   \
00299         NULL)) : NULL)
00300 #  else
00301 #    define BLI_assert(a)                                                     \
00302     (void)((!(a)) ?  (                                                        \
00303         (                                                                     \
00304         fprintf(stderr,                                                       \
00305             "BLI_assert failed: %s:%d, at \'%s\'\n",                          \
00306             __FILE__, __LINE__, STRINGIFY(a)),                                \
00307         _BLI_DUMMY_ABORT(),                                                   \
00308         NULL)) : NULL)
00309 #  endif
00310 #else
00311 #  define BLI_assert(a) (void)0
00312 #endif
00313 
00314 /* hints for branch pradiction, only use in code that runs a _lot_ where */
00315 #ifdef __GNUC__
00316 #  define LIKELY(x)       __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
00317 #  define UNLIKELY(x)     __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
00318 #else
00319 #  define LIKELY(x)       (x)
00320 #  define UNLIKELY(x)     (x)
00321 #endif
